questions.question: The total number of Hamiltonian circuits in a complete undirected graph of n vertices will be ____
If G is a simple graph with n-vertices and n>=3, the condition for G has a Hamiltonian circuit is _________

answers.a: the degree of each vertex is at most n/2
answers.b: the degree of each vertex is equal to n
answers.c: the degree of every vertex is at least n+1/2
answers.d: the degree of every vertex in G is at least n/2

explanations.d: A simple circuit in a graph G that passes through every vertex exactly once is called a Hamiltonian circuit. If there is a vertex of degree one in a graph then it is impossible for it to have a Hamiltonian circuit. If G is a simple graph with n-vertices and n>=3 such that the degree of every vertex in G is at least n/2, then G has a Hamiltonian circuit.

questions.question: Consider a connected multigraph with 8 vertices has an Euler circuit. Which of the following degrees is possible for each vertex so that the graph has an Euler circuit?

explanations.b: A connected multigraph with at least two vertices has an Euler circuit if and only if each of its vertices has an even degree. Therefore, out of the given options, 4 is the degree possible for each vertex so that the graph has a Euler circuit.
